resolutions.description: Always have something in my ears or scrolling. Want more quiet time with my own thoughts. Scary but probably healthy.

resolutions.title: Make bed every morning
resolutions.description: Sounds dumb but I never make my bed. They say starting with one small win sets up your day. Trying it.

resolutions.title: Journal 3x a week
resolutions.description: Thoughts are always swirling. Writing them down is supposed to help. Doesnt need to be daily, starting with 3x.

resolutions.title: Gym twice a week
resolutions.description: Just need to go. Twice a week is manageable. Not trying to be a bodybuilder just want basic fitness.

resolutions.title: Learn sign language basics
resolutions.description: Have a deaf coworker and want to communicate better with her. Learning basic ASL through online courses.

resolutions.title: Reduce caffeine intake
resolutions.description: Drinking too much coffee and feeling jittery. Cutting back to 2 cups max before noon. No afternoon caffeine.

resolutions.title: Be on time
resolutions.description: Always running 5-10 minutes late for everything. Its disrespectful of other peoples time. Setting alarms and leaving earlier.

resolutions.title: Cut back on online shopping
resolutions.description: Amazon cart is always full. Buying stuff I dont need. New rule - wait 48 hours before buying anything nonessential.

resolutions.title: Exercise daily even if short
resolutions.description: Something is better than nothing. Even just 10 minutes counts. No zero days.

resolutions.title: Try one new thing monthly
resolutions.description: Life is too routine. Want to try something new each month. New restaurant, new hobby, new experience. Anything.

resolutions.title: Improve posture
resolutions.description: Slouching constantly and back always hurts. Going to be more mindful of posture. Maybe get a standing desk.

resolutions.title: Meal plan Sundays
resolutions.description: Winging it leads to bad food choices. Going to plan the weeks meals every Sunday. Prep what I can.

resolutions.title: Call a friend weekly
resolutions.description: Everyone texts but never actually talks. Going to call at least one friend per week for a real conversation.

resolutions.title: No screens before bed
resolutions.description: Blue light is messing with sleep. No phone tablet or TV for the last hour before bed. Read or do something else.

resolutions.title: Practice gratitude daily
resolutions.description: Think about what Im grateful for every morning. Just mentally listing 3 things. Supposed to improve outlook on life.

journals.content: Sweet as, managed to get out 3 times this week! Wasnt far just did a loop around the neighbourhood each time maybe 3-4km. Legs are feeling it today but in a good way. Weather has been mint so that helped heaps.

Only cooked once this week and it was just pasta with jar sauce. Rest of the week was takeaways and frozen stuff. New years week is hectic though so giving myself some grace. Will do better next week hopefully.
Right so I set up an automatic transfer for €50 every Friday. Not the full 200 yet but building up to it. Didnt go to the pub at all this week which is fairly unheard of for me. Small wins like.

Started Atomic Habits cause everyone bangs on about it. About 80 pages in already. Its actually grand not as dry as I thought. Reading on the bus to work instead of scrolling through shite on instagram.

One week without cigarettes. It is very difficult but I am using nicotine patches and they help somewhat. The hardest moments are after eating and with coffee. My girlfriend checks on me which helps me stay accountable.

Cycled every work day this week. The weather was cold but dry so it was actually quite pleasant. Takes about 25 minutes which is almost the same as driving with traffic. I feel more awake when I arrive at office.
Practiced Dutch twice. Thats it. Between work and social stuff for new years I just didnt make time. Lost my Duolingo streak which is annoying. Need to be more disciplined about this.

I studied English every day this week. I watch YouTube videos with subtitles and practice speaking with language exchange app. My vocabulary is improving but speaking still makes me nervous. I worry about making mistakes.
4 out of 7 days hitting 8000 steps. New Year holiday was very busy with family visiting and I could not go walking. I am disappointed but I will try harder next week when normal schedule returns.

No work on Saturday or Sunday! This is first time in many months. My wife was very happy. We went to a shrine together for hatsumode and spent time with the children. It felt strange to not check email but good strange.

5 AM club is happening! Managed 6 out of 7 days. The first two days were very hard but now my body is adjusting. Using this time for exercise and reading. Family is still sleeping so it is peaceful time for myself only.
Completed 2 modules of AWS course. IAM section was confusing initially but I watched additional videos on YouTube and concepts are more clear now. Planning to complete EC2 and S3 modules next week.

Meditated 6 out of 7 days using Headspace app. Only missed one day because I overslept. Its harder than I thought to quiet the mind but Im starting to notice I feel calmer in the mornings. Baby steps.

Transferred Rs 15000 to savings account. Also cancelled two subscriptions I was not using - Spotify family plan that only I use and some fitness app I downloaded months ago. Small amounts but they add up.

Called home on Tuesday and Saturday. Mummy was so happy she talked for almost one hour on Saturday haha. Told her about this resolution and she said she will remind me if I forget to call. Now I have accountability partner!
Meditated only 3 times this week. Kept telling myself I would do it later and then forgetting. The mornings were too rushed with holiday guests staying. Need to find a consistent time that works.

One week without cigarettes! I wont lie it was extremely difficult. Using nicotine patches and chewing gum like crazy. The craving after meals is the worst. But I keep thinking of my health and my family. I can do this.
Started reading LEtranger by Camus. I read it in school but wanted to revisit. About 50 pages in so far. Reading before bed instead of watching Netflix. My sleep is already better I think.
Went to gym Monday Wednesday and Friday! The gym was very crowded with new year people but I managed to do my workout. Feeling sore but good sore. Already looking forward to next week.

Did not touch the piano this week. I was busy with New Year celebrations and visiting family. I know it is an excuse but the week was truly hectic. Next week I will start properly when life returns to normal routine.

Drank 2 liters of water every day! I bought a big bottle that shows measurements and I keep it at my desk. Had to go to the toilet more often haha but my skin already feels less dry. Simple but effective.

No alcohol Monday through Thursday. It was surprisingly not too difficult. I bought alcohol free beer Clausthaler for the evenings and it satisfied the habit of having something. Friday had two beers and enjoyed them more than usual.

Worked on the app for 5 hours total this week. Fixed a database bug that was bothering me for months and started implementing the new dashboard. Progress is progress even if slow. The code is messy but I will refactor later.

Ran 3 times this week following the program. Only managed about 2.5km each time before walking but thats expected at this stage. The program says to go slow and build up. My legs are quite sore but no injuries.
Duolingo every day plus signed up for an online course that starts next week. Also changed my phone language to Spanish which is confusing but forcing me to learn. Puedo hacerlo!
Guitar practice happened twice. Thats all. New year week was chaotic with visitors and parties. Not a good excuse but its the truth. Starting fresh this week with a proper schedule.

Did my first meal prep on Sunday! Made a big batch of chicken curry and rice, portioned into containers for the work week. It took about 2 hours but now I have lunch for 5 days. Already saved money by not buying lunch on Monday.
Went twice. Just twice. Monday was good but then got busy and kept pushing it off. Gym was absolutely packed which didnt help my motivation. Need to stop making excuses.

Called mum Sunday arvo and we chatted for like 45 minutes. More than weve talked in ages. She was stoked. Set a reminder on my phone for every Sunday 4pm so I dont forget. She said she looks forward to it now.

Phone went on charge in the lounge room at 9pm every night this week. First couple nights I kept reaching for it out of habit but it wasnt there. Started reading a book instead. Sleep has been way better already.

Set up automatic transfer of $125 every Friday into high interest savings. First one went through yesterday. Also switched to a better account with 5% interest. Not touching this money for anything. House deposit here I come eventually.

No energy drinks! Switched to coffee in the morning and water rest of the day. First couple days had headaches probably from caffeine withdrawal but feeling better now. Also saving money - those things are like $5 each.
Didnt surf at all this week. Weather was rubbish for most of it and then I just got lazy on the weekend. Board is still sitting in the garage collecting dust. Bit disappointed in myself tbh.

Started a Python course on Codecademy. Done about 3 hours of lessons so far. Its actually pretty fun? Made a little program that says hello world which I know is basic but still felt cool to make something work.

Didnt volunteer this week. I know I said once a month so technically Im not behind yet but I also didnt contact the animal shelter like I planned. Going to email them today and ask about orientation sessions.

Put $450 toward the credit card this week! Got some Christmas money from my parents so threw it all on there. Down to about $4,350 now. Seeing that number drop feels really good eh. Momentum is building.
Went to Whistler on Saturday! Conditions were amazing, fresh powder. Legs were absolutely cooked by the end but worth it. Already planning to go again next weekend. Thats 1 down 9 to go.

Journaled every single night! Just writing whatever comes to mind for 10-15 minutes before bed. Some nights its boring stuff some nights its deeper thoughts. Already noticing Im sleeping better, less racing thoughts.
Two walks every day with Charlie! Morning one is short like 15 mins just around the block. Evening one is longer, we go to the park. Hes definitely got more energy and so do I. Win win situation.

No fast food all week! Came close on Thursday when I was exhausted after work but made a quick pasta instead. Surprisingly not as hard as I thought. Already feel less bloated and saved probably $50 this week alone.

Phone stays in the kitchen after 8pm now. Reading a book called Project Hail Mary by Andy Weir. Finished like 100 pages already which is more than I read all last month probably. Eyes feel less strained too.

Havent started French lessons yet. The community centre course doesnt start until Jan 15 so technically Im not behind. But I also havent been practicing on my own like I planned. Going to download Duolingo tonight.

Meditated every morning using Headspace. 10 minutes right after waking up before I check my phone. Some days my mind is racing and it feels useless, other days I actually feel calm after. Sticking with it to see if it helps long term.

Ran 3 times following the C25K program. Week 1 is run 60 seconds walk 90 seconds repeat. Sounds easy but Im pretty out of shape so it was a challenge. No injuries though and thats the main thing. June feels far away but also close.
Cooked maybe twice this week. Ordered Uber Eats three times which is bad. The holidays threw off my routine and I kept saying tomorrow. Spent way too much money on delivery fees.

Failed miserably at this. Screen time report says I averaged 2 hours on social media per day. Kept bypassing the limits. I think I need a more drastic approach, maybe deleting the apps entirely? Open to suggestions.

Made it to yoga 3 times! Tuesday Thursday and Saturday mornings. The instructor is really good at explaining poses for beginners. My back still hurts but I can already touch my toes a bit easier. Progress.

Coffee spending down to $45 this week! Made coffee at home most days using a French press. Got a reusable cup so I can treat myself to one Starbucks on Fridays without guilt. $45 vs $300 is a massive difference.

Rubbish week honestly. Only hit 10k steps twice. Weather has been absolutely miserable and I used it as an excuse to stay in. Need to stop being such a wimp about a bit of rain. Buying a proper waterproof jacket this week.

Phone has been charging in the kitchen all week! Bought a little alarm clock from Argos for 8 quid. First couple nights I kept reaching for it but it wasnt there. Slept so much better. Actually read a book before bed like a normal person.
7 days smoke free! Using patches and keeping busy. The cravings are mental but Im managing. Whenever I want a cigarette I do 10 pushups instead. My arms are going to be massive at this rate haha.

Played chess every day on chess.com! My rating is rubbish but slowly improving. Joined a local club that meets on Wednesdays, going to my first session this week. A bit nervous but excited to play real people.

Swam twice! Wednesday and Saturday mornings before work. The pool was quieter than I expected. Did about 20 lengths each time, mix of front crawl and breaststroke. Shoulders are sore but good sore. Really enjoying it.
Had drinks 4 nights this week. New years week was rough with all the social events. Hard to say no when everyones celebrating. Will try again this week now that things are calmer.

Only checked news once a day this week! Just a quick 10 min scan in the morning with my coffee. Deleted the news apps from my phone so I cant mindlessly browse. Feel noticeably less anxious about the state of the world.

Started on the bedroom! Filled 3 bin bags with clothes I havent worn in years. Took them to the charity shop. Already feels more spacious. Next week tackling the wardrobe properly. Marie Kondo would be proud.

Did strength training Tuesday and Thursday! Just basic stuff with dumbbells - bicep curls, shoulder press, squats. Following a YouTube video for beginners. Arms are killing me but in a good way. Can definitely feel it working.

Only took a proper lunch break twice this week. Old habits die hard. Kept telling myself I'll eat at my desk just this once and before I know it its 3pm. Need to set a proper reminder and actually leave my desk.

Stretched every morning for about 10 minutes. Found a routine on YouTube. Hamstrings still tight as anything, not sure if Im even doing it right tbh. But I guess consistency matters more than perfection? Well see.

Made shakshuka for the first time! Saw it on Instagram and looked dead easy. Turned out pretty well actually. Also made a Thai curry from scratch, not just a jar. Actually enjoying cooking when its something new.

Transferred 300 quid to savings! Also cancelled Amazon Prime which I was barely using. Going to unsubscribe from a few other things this week too. Every little helps as they say. Account balance is growing.

7 days no vape! NGL the first 3 days were brutal. Headaches irritability the whole deal. Chewing a lot of gum. My girlfriend hid all my vape stuff so I couldnt cheat. Cravings still there but getting easier.
Started a sci-fi book my friend recommended. About 100 pages in already which is more than I read all last year probably. Reading before bed instead of scrolling TikTok. Sleep is better too.
Duolingo streak at 7 days! Also been listening to a podcast called SpanishPod101 during my commute. My wife keeps quizzing me on random words which helps even if she laughs at my pronunciation lol

Ok so I caved on Thursday. Long day at work and just drove through McDonalds without thinking. Force of habit. Rest of the week was good though. Did meal prep Sunday, made chicken and rice bowls for the week.
Gym happened once. Once! Kept telling myself Id go tomorrow. The new years crowd made it extra annoying which gave me more excuses. Pretty disappointed but trying again next week.
Set up automatic transfer of $125 every Friday to savings. First one went through. Also cancelled a subscription I wasnt using. Small start but gotta start somewhere. $500/month here I come.

Meditated every morning this week using Calm app. Some days my mind wont shut up and I feel like Im doing it wrong. Other days I actually feel relaxed after. Gonna stick with it and see if it helps long term.
Started the C25K program. Week 1 is run 1 min walk 90 seconds repeat. Did 3 sessions this week. Its harder than it sounds when youre out of shape lol. March feels far away but also not that far.

Journaled every night before bed! Just writing whatever is on my mind for 10 mins. Some nights its boring stuff some nights deeper thoughts. Definitely falling asleep faster when I get things out of my head.
Caved and had like 5 cokes this week. There were sodas everywhere at new years parties and I just kept grabbing them without thinking. The habit is more automatic than I realized. Ugh.

Called mom on Sunday and we talked for like an hour. She was so happy. Told her about my resolutions and she said shes proud of me. Set a weekly reminder so I dont forget. Its such a small thing that means so much to her.
3 out of 7 days hitting 10k steps. Work from home makes it hard, you dont even realize youve barely moved all day. Need to set reminders to take walks. Going to try walking meetings when possible.

Practiced guitar 6 out of 7 days! Following Justin Guitar on YouTube. Can almost play a full chord change from G to C now. Fingers hurt like crazy but apparently thats normal at first. Calluses coming.

No alcohol Monday through Thursday! Had wine on Friday and Saturday night but kept it to 2 glasses each. Actually enjoyed it more when its a treat rather than a daily habit. Sleep has been better too.
Stretched every morning for 10 mins using a YouTube video. My hamstrings are so tight its embarrassing. Already feel a tiny bit more flexible though. Back doesnt hurt as much when I sit at my desk.

Read for about an hour each day instead of scrolling. Finishing a thriller called Gone Girl. Screen time is way down according to my phone. Feels good to actually finish pages instead of just scrolling endlessly.

Did my first meal prep on Sunday! Made a big batch of turkey chili and portioned it into containers. Had lunch ready all week. Saved prolly $50 in delivery fees and its healthier too. Kicking myself for not starting this sooner.
Practiced piano once. Just once. The keyboard is still set up but I keep walking past it. Need to figure out a consistent time to practice because winging it isnt working.
Drinking more water I guess. Got a big 32oz bottle and trying to refill it 3 times a day. Mostly just peeing constantly. Not sure I feel any different yet but everyone says it takes time so whatever.

Deleted the Amazon app! Had one moment of weakness where I almost redownloaded it but stopped myself. If I really need something I can use the website which is more friction. Saved probably $100 already.
Exercised once. Did one yoga video on Wednesday and thats it. Kept saying Id do it later and then it was bedtime. This is exactly the pattern I was trying to break. Frustrated with myself.
Ugh failed at this already. Still averaging like 3 hours on social media. I set limits but then just bypass them. Need a different strategy, maybe having someone else set my passcode for the limits?
Flossed every single night! Put the floss right next to my toothbrush so I see it. Takes like 2 minutes. Gums bled a lot at first but getting better. Dentist is gonna be shocked in 6 months lol.
Only woke up at 6am twice. The other days I hit snooze until 7. Need to put my alarm across the room. Hard during the dark winter mornings but Im not giving up. Next week will be better.

Did yoga 3 times following Yoga with Adriene on YouTube. Shes great for beginners. Im not flexible at all and some poses are hard but she always offers modifications. Actually relaxing once you get into it.
Had vegetables with dinner every day! Mostly just steamed broccoli and salads but it counts. Bought some frozen veggie mixes to make it easier. Already feel less sluggish. Body probably in shock lol.
Made an extra $200 payment on my student loans. Set up automatic extra payments. Number barely moved tbh, these loans are crushing. But I guess every bit helps? Trying to stay positive about it.

Phone charges in kitchen all week! First couple nights I kept reaching for it but it wasnt there. Got a cheap alarm clock on Amazon (ironic I know). Sleeping so much better. Actually feel rested in the morning.
Took vitamins every day! Put the bottle next to my coffee maker so I see it every morning. Just a multivitamin and vitamin D. Probably wont notice effects for a while but at least Im consistent now.
Did the gratitude journal twice. Both times felt forced and I couldnt think of things. Not sure this is for me but gonna give it another week before quitting. Maybe Im doing it wrong.
Cooked dinner 5 nights! Made pasta, stir fry, tacos, grilled chicken, and soup. Two nights had leftovers. Only ordered Uber Eats once and it was planned. Saved at least $60 compared to usual week.

Zero energy drinks! Switched to black coffee, 2 cups max in the morning. First few days had headaches from caffeine drop but feeling better now. Heart doesnt race anymore. Saving money too those things are expensive.
Biked to work Tuesday and Thursday! Weather was cold but manageable. Takes about 20 mins which is same as driving with traffic. Legs were sore but good sore. Free exercise and saves on gas.

Watched some YouTube tutorials on photography basics. Learned about the exposure triangle finally. Took some practice shots around the house. Still on auto mode mostly but understanding why settings matter now.
Failed at this. Still drinking like 4 cups. The habit is so ingrained. Going to try switching to half caf first as a transition. Cold turkey clearly isnt working. Baby steps.
Stayed up past midnight most nights this week. NYE threw off my schedule and I never recovered. Kept saying just one more episode. Sleep schedule is totally wrecked now.

Hit the weights 3 times! Following the Reddit PPL program. Everything is sore lol. Starting with just the bar on some lifts to learn form. Ego check but better than injury. Already feel stronger somehow.
Didnt volunteer yet. Emailed the food bank but theyre doing orientation next weekend so technically Im on track. Felt like I should have done something this week tho. At least I made contact.

Took a real lunch break 4 out of 5 work days! Actually left my desk, went outside for a walk, ate without staring at a screen. Came back feeling refreshed. Productivity actually went UP not down. Who knew.
Only went to Starbucks once this week (Friday treat). Made coffee at home using a French press, actually tastes better imo. Spent like $7 vs my usual $40+. Thats $140/month I can save. Wild.
Skincare routine happened maybe 3 times. Keep going to bed without remembering. The products are just sitting on my counter staring at me. Need to make it more automatic somehow.

Started a Python course on Codecademy. Done about 4 hours of lessons. Made a hello world program lol. Its actually kind of fun? Like solving puzzles. Long way from building anything real but gotta start somewhere.
Started decluttering the closet! Filled 2 garbage bags with clothes I havent worn in 2+ years. Taking them to Goodwill tomorrow. Already feels more spacious. One area at a time, no rush.

Swam twice this week! Wednesday and Saturday mornings before work. The pool was pretty empty early. Did about 20 laps each time, mix of strokes. Shoulders sore but its a good workout. Might actually enjoy this.
Practiced mindfulness using the Headspace app, 10 mins a day. Mostly breathing exercises and body scans. Some days my mind wanders the whole time but apparently thats normal. Trying to stick with it.
Walked during lunch 4 days! Just 15-20 minutes around the block. Fresh air and movement in the middle of the day makes a big difference. Less of that 2pm slump. Simple but effective.

Set up YNAB to track spending. Entered all my accounts and categorized last months expenses. Honestly shocked at how much I spent on food delivery and random stuff. Knowledge is power I guess. Now to actually budget.

Texted 3 friends I havent talked to in a while! Just checking in, nothing major. Two responded right away and we had nice convos. One hasnt replied yet but thats ok. Felt good to reach out. Why do I not do this more.
One week without smoking! First few nights were rough, sleep was weird, vivid dreams. But already feeling clearer headed in general. Saving money too. Taking it one day at a time.

Worked on the side project for 6 hours this week! Fixed a major bug and made progress on the UI. Actually feeling motivated for once. Set a goal to have a beta version by end of February. Accountability helps.
Found a local tech meetup happening next week and signed up. Nervous but thats the point right. Also connected with 2 people on LinkedIn. Baby steps toward being less of a hermit professionally.
Tried the pomodoro technique! 25 min work, 5 min break. Actually got so much done this week. The timer creates urgency. Not perfect at it yet but way better than my usual procrastination spiral.
Got 8 hours sleep 5 out of 7 nights! Setting a bedtime alarm helps. Two nights I stayed up late but thats still progress. Already feel more alert during the day. Sleep really is that important huh.
Did one hike this week on Saturday! Just an easy 3 mile loop near my house. Weather was nice. Forgot how good it feels to be in nature. Saw some deer. Already planning a longer one for next weekend.
Duolingo every day plus started Pimsleur audio lessons. The audio is better for actually speaking. Can introduce myself and count to 20. Tiny progress but progress nonetheless. Hola!
Screen time went from 6 to 5 hours so technically reduced but not by much. Keep mindlessly opening apps. Deleted TikTok which was the biggest time suck. Will reassess next week.
Had breakfast every day! Nothing fancy just yogurt with granola and fruit most days. A smoothie on Sunday. Actually feel more energized in the mornings and dont overeat at lunch anymore.
Only did pushups 3 days this week. Started strong on Monday then just forgot about it. Didnt even think about it most days which is the problem. Need to set reminders or something.
Havent bitten my nails all week! The bitter polish helps a lot. Catch myself bringing hand to mouth then taste it and stop. Nails are actually growing for once.
Drew twice this week. Kept putting it off because I didnt feel inspired. Thats a dumb excuse I know - the whole point is to practice even when you dont feel like it. Gotta do better.
Hit snooze probably 4 out of 7 days. Ugh. The other 3 I got up immediately though which is progress. Need to put phone across room. Old habits.
Only drank on Saturday! Went to a party and had 2 beers. Thats it for the whole week. Honestly didnt miss it as much as I thought I would. Waking up without any hangover is nice.
Set up automatic $200 transfer on the first of each month into brokerage. First investment went into a total market index fund. Officially an investor now lol. Baby steps to wealth.
Meditated before bed 6 out of 7 nights. Using the Calm sleep stories. Mind still races but falling asleep faster. Also just feels like a nice wind down routine now.
Got outside every single day! Even if just for 15 mins walking around the block. Fresh air and sunshine (when there was any) really does help. Mood definitely better.
Started reading Sapiens! About 50 pages in. Its dense but fascinating. Learning about human history in ways school never taught. Going to take a while to finish but enjoying it.
Did a cleaning session on Sunday! Bathroom and kitchen done. Feels good to start fresh. Will do bedroom and living room next week. Small chunks way easier than marathon cleaning.
Caught myself cracking knuckles like 20 times this week. The stress ball helps when I remember to use it but half the time I crack before I even realize Im doing it. Ugh.
Did yoga twice this week! Found this channel called Breathe and Flow on youtube. The guy explains everything really well for beginners. Already can feel some improvement in how my back feels.
Protein goal was a mess this week. Most meals were whatever was easiest - cereal, sandwiches, takeout. Didnt plan ahead at all. Need to actually buy protein sources and meal prep.
Went out for 3 run/walks this week! Following a beginner program. More walking than running tbh but thats fine. Just building the habit. Lungs burn but in a good way.
Studied for 2 hours 6 out of 7 days! Library is basically my second home at this point lol. Using pomodoro technique. Actual retention is SO much better than cramming the night before an exam.
Zero delivery orders yall! Cooked every meal or picked up in person. Saved atleast $70 in delivery fees alone. Food actually tasted better too. Deleted that Uber Eats app real quick.
Only worked out in the morning twice. Other days kept hitting snooze or just felt too tired. Evening workouts happened instead which is fine but defeats the purpose. Need better sleep.
Wrote 500+ words 5 out of 7 days! Mostly garbage but thats ok. The point is practice. Working on a short story idea. Might actually finish something for once.
No phone for first hour 6 out of 7 days! Morning routine is now shower, breakfast, coffee, then phone. Feels less chaotic. Not immediately stressed by emails or news.
Played chess on chess.com every day! Rating is terrible like 400 but slowly learning. Watching some YouTube videos on basic openings. The Italian Game is my friend now.
Had candy twice this week. Not as bad as usual but not sugar free either. The cravings are real. Eating fruit instead helps sometimes. Its a process.
Woke up at 7am every single day including weekends! Saturday was rough but I did it. Sleep schedule feels more consistent. Actually tired at night now which is good.
Read before bed every night! Getting through a thriller right now. Way better than scrolling Instagram. Eyes dont feel as strained and I actually remember what I read.
Found a running club that meets on Saturdays! Went to my first run. Was nervous but everyone was super nice and welcoming. Different paces so no pressure. Excited to go back.
Touched the guitar twice. Picked it up both times then put it down after 5 mins because my fingers hurt. I know thats part of it but its discouraging. Maybe I need better tutorials or something.
No eating after 8pm all week! Had to white knuckle through some cravings but did it. Herbal tea helps. Sleeping better too actually. Who knew late night snacking affected sleep.
Phone goes in glovebox every time I drive now! Habit is forming. Realized I used to glance at it constantly. So dangerous. Nothing is that urgent it cant wait.

Set up Mint and tracked all spending. The numbers are... bruhhh. $400 on food delivery last month?? deadass?? Creating actual budget categories now. This is embarassing but whatever knowledge is power i guess.
Walked 30 mins every day! Just around the neighborhood listening to podcasts. Easy and enjoyable. Already noticing I have more energy. Simple but effective.
Learned to make stir fry and fried rice this week! Both turned out edible which is a win. YouTube cooking tutorials are actually helpful. 2 recipes down 8 to go.
Cold shower every morning! Just last 30 seconds cold. Its brutal but I do feel more awake after. Apparently gets easier. Day 7 wasnt as shocking as day 1.
Only stuck to 1 hour twice. Other nights binge watched stuff. Its so easy to just keep going. Need to set an actual timer that turns TV off or something.
Made a collage from old magazines! Its not great art but it was fun and relaxing. Nice to make something with my hands instead of just consuming content.
Set hourly reminders to stretch. Actually followed them most of the time. Just basic neck rolls and shoulder stretches. Back feels less tense by end of day now.
Averaged about 6k steps. Better than my usual 3k but not 10k yet. Going to add a lunch walk to help get there. Progress not perfection right?
January skill is origami! Watched some tutorials and made a paper crane. Its actually pretty meditative. Going to learn more complex folds this month.
Caught myself complaining a few times and stopped. Reframed things more positively. Its hard to break negative patterns but awareness is the first step. Friends even noticed I seem more upbeat.
Saved $100 this week! Set up automatic transfer on Fridays. Barely notice its gone. Already $100 closer to my emergency fund goal. Compound consistency.
Fixed the wobbly shelf in the bathroom! Took 10 minutes and a screwdriver. Why did I let that annoy me for months? Feeling handy. Next up: that sticky door.
Had vegetables with dinner every night! Mostly broccoli and salads because easy. But hey it counts. Bought some frozen veggie mixes for variety. Body probably in shock lol.
Bought pots and soil and planted basil and mint! Theyre sitting on the balcony now. No idea if theyll survive but excited to try. YouTube has good beginner gardening tips.
Ran 3 times this week! Well, run/walked. But I got out there. Using a C25K app. Slow progress but progress. Just need to keep showing up.
Had a few hours of quiet time this week. No podcasts, no scrolling, just my thoughts. Uncomfortable at first but kind of nice? Realized how rarely Im not consuming something.
Made my bed like 3 times. Such a simple thing and I still couldnt do it consistently. Just walk right past it every morning rushing to start the day. This should be easy why is it hard.
Journaled 3 times this week! Just stream of consciousness stuff. Getting thoughts out of my head helps. Some entries are complaints, some are plans, some are random. All valid.
Hit the gym twice! Wednesday and Saturday. Just did some machines and light cardio. Place was packed but got my workouts in. Sore but good sore.
Learning ASL alphabet and basic greetings! Used Lifeprint.com which is free. My coworker was touched that Im learning. Signed hello to her on Friday. Long way to go but starting.
Had 3 cups most days instead of 2. One day had 4 because rough morning. Getting better but not there yet. The afternoon cup is the hardest to give up. Maybe switch to decaf?
Was on time for everything this week! Left 10 mins earlier than I thought I needed. Buffer time is key. People actually commented that Im early now. Feels good to be reliable.
Only bought one thing on Amazon and I waited 48 hours first! Still wanted it after so I bought it. But passed on like 3 other things I wouldve impulse bought. System works.
Had 4 zero days this week. The no zero days thing is harder than it sounds when youre tired and busy. Even a 10 min walk felt like too much some nights. Need a lower bar.
Tried a new restaurant! Ethiopian food for the first time. It was amazing, ate with my hands using injera bread. Already planning what new thing to try next month.
Set up hourly posture reminders on my phone. Catching myself slouching and correcting. Also raised my monitor to eye level. Back already feels slightly better.
Meal planned on Sunday! Made a grocery list and stuck to it. Prepped some stuff in advance. Whole week I knew what I was eating. Less stress less waste less spending.
Called my college friend on Tuesday! Talked for like an hour catching up. Way better than texting. Why dont we do this more often? Already planning to call another friend next week.
No screens last hour before bed all week! Read books instead. Sleep quality is noticeably better. Not tossing and turning as much. Who knew blue light was that bad.
Thought of 3 grateful things every morning! Coffee, my dog, having a warm bed. Simple stuff but it does shift my mindset. Starting the day positive instead of dreading things.

posts.content: Anyone else finding it hard to stay motivated now that the NYE buzz has worn off? First of Jan was all excitement and big plans, now its just grey skies and back to work tomorrow. Trying to remind myself why I started.

Small tip for fellow early risers - keep your alarm across the room so you must physically get up to switch it off. Once you are standing you are awake. Also splashing cold water on face immediately helps a lot. What are your morning tricks?
Gym was absolutely heaving this morning. Had to wait 15 mins for a squat rack. Part of me is annoyed but honestly good on everyone for giving it a crack. We were all new once.
Just realised I havent touched my phone for 3 hours. Might not sound like much but for me thats massive. Been reading instead. Forgot how nice it is to just not be connected for a bit.

I read somewhere that the third week is the hardest when quitting smoking. First week you have motivation, second week you have some progress, third week you only have the difficult feelings. Is this true for others here?
Is anyone else doing meditation for the first time? I feel like I am doing it wrong. My mind never stops thinking. Maybe this is normal at the beginning?
First day of the year. Wrote down my goals properly this time instead of just thinking about them vaguely. Not sure if itll make a difference but worth a shot I guess. Heres to 2026.
Question for people learning languages - do you find apps like Duolingo helpful or should I focus on real conversation practice? I feel like I am learning words but cannot speak naturally.
Non alcoholic beer has been a game changer for me. Still feels like I am having a beer in the evening but without the negative effects. Anyone have brand recommendations?

Got up early and went for a surf before work. Best decision ever. The ocean was glass and I had it mostly to myself. If youre thinking about starting something similar just do it. Morning exercise hits different.

First week of cooking instead of ordering in and its actually not as bad as I thought? The actual cooking takes like 30 mins, same time as waiting for delivery. Just needed to get over the mental barrier I guess.
Day 4 without cigarettes and Im climbing the walls. Please tell me this gets easier. Ive quit before and always failed around the 2 week mark. Determined to push through this time.
To everyone who is struggling with their resolutions already - remember that one bad day does not erase all your progress. You can start again tomorrow. This is not all or nothing approach.
My screen time is down 40% this week just from keeping phone in another room at night. Such a simple change but massive impact. Highly recommend if you struggle with late night scrolling.
Started journaling this week and already finding it helpful. Just getting thoughts out of my head and onto paper makes them feel less overwhelming somehow. Anyone else journal?
Went to pub quiz last night and just had soft drinks. Mates were confused at first but nobody actually cared. Realised a lot of my drinking was just habit rather than actually wanting a drink.
Running update: still cant run more than 2km without stopping but thats ok. The program says to go slow. Comparing myself to me a week ago not to marathon runners.
Made shakshuka for the first time today. Looked up a recipe online and just went for it. Actually turned out pretty good? Feeling accomplished. What new recipes have you lot tried this week?
Called my parents today and my mother was so happy she cried a little. Made me realise how much these small things matter to them. If you havent called your family in a while maybe do it today?
Day 3 no vape and Im fixin to lose my mind. Tell me it gets easier?? Everyone at work vapes and keeps offerin me hits without thinkin. Might have to avoid the break room for a hot minute.
First gym session of the year done! Place was absolutely packed, had to wait for every machine. But hey at least everyones trying right? We were all beginners at some point.
Anyone else struggle with calling their parents regularly? I love my mom but somehow weeks go by without talking. Set a weekly reminder and it actually helps a lot.
Relearning piano as an adult is humbling. Used to be able to play pretty well as a kid. Now Im fumbling through basic scales. Muscle memory is slowly coming back though!
Trying to become a morning person and its rough. Any tips from you early risers? Currently hitting snooze 5 times minimum.
Night 3 of phone in another room while I sleep. Keep reaching for it out of habit and its not there. But Im actually reading books before bed now? Wild concept.
Biked to work today in 35 degree weather. Am I crazy? Maybe. But got my heart rate up and saved on gas. Anyone else bike commute in winter?
Actually took a real lunch break today. Went outside, walked around, ate without working. Came back feeling refreshed instead of burned out. Why dont I do this every day?
Started learning Python and made my first program print hello world. I know its nothing but it feels like magic when it actually works. Anyone else learning to code this year?
Taking a tolerance break from weed and the first few nights are ROUGH. Sleep is all messed up. Vivid dreams. Anyone else going through this? How long til it gets better?
Pomodoro technique is changing my life. 25 min focused work then 5 min break. Getting more done than I have in months. Why didnt anyone tell me about this sooner?
Started doing walking meetings instead of sitting in conference rooms. Fresh air + movement + work discussion. Everyone should try this. Meetings are actually productive now.
Saturday morning hike to start the weekend right. Saw deer and had the trail mostly to myself. Living near nature and not taking advantage of it was dumb. No more excuses.
Week 1 of couch to 5k complete! My lungs are burning but I did it. March feels so far away but also not that far? One run at a time.
day 4. nothing special to report. just doing it
went to gym. it was fine i guess. not really feeling it today but showed up anyway
almost didnt do my thing today. did like half of it. better than nothing i guess?
meh week. not proud but not giving up either
showed up late to my workout but technically still counts right
Day 2 of trying to not hit snooze and I failed immediately. This is going to be harder than I thought. Anyone have tips for actually getting up when the alarm goes off?
First run of 2026! More walking than running tbh but I did it. Lungs are burning and legs feel like jello but hey its a start. Anyone else just starting to run?
Wrote 600 words today on my short story! Its probably terrible but the point is just getting words on paper. Perfectionism is the enemy of progress or whatever.
Joined a running club today! Was so nervous walking up but everyone was super friendly and welcoming. Different pace groups so no pressure. Highly recommend finding a group.
Cold showers are NO JOKE. Day 3 and I still dread it. But I do feel more awake after. Anyone else doing this? Tell me it gets easier.
Learning origami as my January new skill. Made a paper crane today after like 5 failed attempts. Such a peaceful activity. Good break from screens.
Planted my first herb garden today! Just basil and mint in pots on the balcony. Probably going to kill them but excited to try. Any gardening tips from plant people?
Learning ASL so I can communicate better with my deaf coworker. Just started with the alphabet. She was so touched when I signed hello to her. Small effort huge impact.
Tried Ethiopian food for the first time today! Eating with my hands using injera bread was so fun. 2026 is the year of new experiences for me.
Called an old friend instead of just texting. Talked for an hour catching up. Why dont we do this more? Texting is fine but actual conversation hits different.
Set up my first investment account and put $200 into index funds. Officially an investor now lol. Small start but gotta start somewhere. Future me will thank present me.
Daily walks are such an underrated form of exercise. 30 minutes listening to podcasts and I feel so much better. Simple effective free. Why complicate it?
Making my bed every morning sounds dumb but it actually helps. Starting the day with one small win. Room looks better too. The little things add up.
honestly feeling pretty discouraged rn. already messed up my sugar goal multiple times this week. feel like everyone else here is doing great and im just failing. idk maybe resolutions arent for me

Work has been so insane this week I literally havent had time for ANY of my resolutions. Was supposed to clean every weekend but ended up working saturday AND sunday. Is it even worth trying anymore if work is just gonna keep taking over my life??

replies.content: 100% feeling this. The excitement of a fresh start fades quick doesnt it. Ive started writing down WHY I want to change in my notes app and read it when motivation dips. Sounds cheesy but it helps.
The beginning is always the most difficult, but also the most important. Un jour à la fois - one day at a time. We do not need to be perfect, only consistent.
Not cheesy at all, thats a great shout actually. Just wrote mine down. Thanks for the tip!
Mate the alarm across the room thing is genius. Gonna try that tomorrow. I keep hitting snooze like 5 times otherwise haha
Thank you for sharing this advice. I also prepare my clothes the night before so I do not need to think in the morning. It saves time and energy when I am still sleepy.
Yes! I do the same thing. Even gym clothes ready. Everything to reduce friction in the morning.
Haha same at my gym. Parking lot was insane. Give it 3 weeks and itll thin out unfortunately. Good attitude about it though.
This is why I go at 6am. Very few people at that time. Maybe you could try going earlier or later to avoid the crowd?
6am is rough but you might be onto something. Might try it next week once the body clock adjusts
Im quitting vaping and its similar. The psychological habit is harder than the physical. We just gotta push through. You got this!
Week 3 was hard for me when I quit before but I also found week 1 the worst. Everyone is different. Just dont give up!
yeah thats normal dont worry. my brain still goes crazy most sessions lol. I just try to notice when im distracted and come back to breathing. some days are better than others
Totally normal. I thought I was doing it wrong for weeks. Apparently thinking your mind never stops IS the meditation lol. Youre doing fine.
This is very helpful, thank you. I will try to be more patient with myself.
Im learning Spanish too! Apps are good for vocab but I found talking to actual people helps way more for conversation. My wife quizzes me which helps even tho she laughs at my accent.
Both! Apps build vocab but you need real practice for speaking. Try changing your phone language to the target language, forces you to learn quickly.
Athletic Brewing makes great NA beer. Tastes like actual craft beer. Also Heineken 0.0 is surprisingly good. Game changer for cutting back.
Lagunitas IPNA is my go-to. Actually tastes like a real IPA. Also Partake Brewing if youre in Canada.
It gets easier I promise! Im on week 1 with cigarettes too. First days are worst. Your body is healing even when it doesnt feel like it. Stay strong!

I successfully quit five years ago after numerous failed attempts. The strategy that ultimately proved effective was habit substitution - whenever I experienced a craving, I would perform ten push-ups instead. It may sound unconventional, but this approach addresses both the physical restlessness and the psychological need for ritual.
Thanks for the encouragement. We got this together!
Needed to hear this today. Had a rough day yesterday and felt like giving up. But youre right one bad day doesnt erase progress. Back at it today.

This is an important reminder. Progress is rarely linear - there will inevitably be fluctuations in motivation and performance. The critical factor is maintaining long-term commitment rather than abandoning one's goals after a setback.
Day 5 with cigarettes here too. Not gonna lie the cravings still suck but theyre less constant than day 1. Apparently week 2 is when it starts getting better. Hang in there
Definitely gets easier! I quit smoking 2 years ago. First week is brutal, second week is hard, third week onwards it slowly gets better. You got this.
Thanks man. Were in this together. Day 5 for you is goals. Keep it up
saaame lol new years crowd is crazy rn but hey at least ppl are trying right?? respect to everyone showing up tbh. itll thin out in a few weeks but hopefully some of us actually stick w it haha
Keep alarm far away so you must get up to switch it off! Once you are standing you are awake. This trick changed my mornings completely.
Open the blinds immediately! Natural light signals your brain to wake up. Also dont look at phone first thing - the dread of emails makes you want to go back to sleep lol
I cycle to work in Netherlands and winter is definitely harder but you get used to it. Good waterproof jacket and gloves make big difference. Worth it though!
yooo same!! just started python and ngl hello world hitting different when it actually runs haha. we gonna be devs by end of year at this rate no cap
Python is great for beginners. Check out Automate the Boring Stuff, its free online and teaches practical stuff. Youll be automating tasks in no time.
Been there. First week is the hardest. Dreams get crazy vivid but it passes. Usually takes about 2 weeks for sleep to normalize. Hang in there.
Just discovered pomodoro too and its amazing. The timer creates urgency. Also the breaks are forced which is good for my workaholic tendencies.
Nice! Im also doing C25K. Week 1 done. March race is gonna be here before we know it honestly
I failed day 1 lol. Alarm across room is the only thing that works for me. Also helps to have a reason to get up like exercise or nice breakfast.
Sleep earlier! Hard to wake up early when you went to bed at 1am. I set bedtime alarm now too. Sounds dumb but works.
Same! More walking than running at this point but were out there. Thats what matters. Progress over perfection. Well be running full miles by spring.
running groups r literally the best fr. accountability hits diff and its so much better than running solo. glad u found a good crew!!
Day 4 here. It does NOT feel easier yet lol. But Im told it does eventually. The wake up effect is real though. Coffee who?
Wait I just replied to myself lol. Meant to say solidarity to anyone else doing cold showers!

I would recommend beginning with culinary herbs, as they tend to be quite resilient. Basil requires substantial direct sunlight. Mint is particularly hardy - though be cautious as it can become invasive if not contained. Water based on soil moisture rather than a fixed schedule.
Dont overwater! Thats what kills most beginner plants. Stick your finger in soil, if its dry then water. If damp, wait. Good luck with your garden!
This is so thoughtful! Learning someones language shows real respect. Im sure your coworker really appreciates it
Right?? Voice calls feel almost old fashioned now but theyre so much better than texting. You can actually catch up properly. Going to call my mom tonight.
Congrats! Index funds are the way to go. Set it and forget it. Time in the market beats timing the market. Future you will definitely thank present you.
Totally agree! Walking is so underrated. Its free, low impact, can do it anywhere. I do the same thing
The Admiral McRaven thing! I started doing this too after watching that speech. One small win first thing sets the tone. My room looks better too lol
The after dinner craving is SO real. Thats when I struggle most too. Having a supportive partner makes such a difference. One week is amazing!
6 out of 7 is excellent! I also find morning time very precious. No interruptions, quiet house. What do you read in the morning?
Currently reading Ikigai, seemed fitting for new year goal setting. Have you read it? Very calming book actually.
Ha yes the January gym crowd. But good on you for getting 4 sessions in week one. That is serious commitment. What program are you following?
PPL split - push pull legs. Found it on reddit actually. Pretty straightforward and hits everything twice a week.
7 days is one week! Big milestone. The headaches should stop soon. For me they lasted about 5 days then got much better
Meal prep is a game changer right? I started this week too. So much easier to eat healthy when the food is already made. Why didnt we start this sooner?
Gratitude journaling buddies! Im doing this too. Some days its hard to think of stuff but thats when its most important right? Shifts the mindset.
One week! The vivid dreams are wild right? Means your brain is finally getting proper REM sleep again. It gets better, promise.
Pomodoro plus library is undefeated combo. Wish I knew this in undergrad. Better late than never. Good luck with your studies!
Running clubs are so great for accountability. Ive been thinking about joining one too. Might have to look for one in my area.
Cold showers are brutal but effective. Day 7 was definitely easier than day 1 for me. The mental toughness aspect is almost as good as the physical benefits.
thats really cool that youre learning for your coworker. i bet she appreciates it
Voice calls are underrated! I called my mom this week too after reading posts here. She was so happy. Why dont we do this more often?
The weather excuse is real! Got myself a good rain jacket and it helps a lot. Still not fun walking in rain but at least Im dry.
Have you tried deleting the apps entirely? I know its extreme but it worked for me. Can still access on browser which is just enough friction to break the habit.
Actually nvm I see youre having same struggle as me lol. Were in this together I guess.
Nice progress on the credit card! Seeing that number go down is so motivating eh. I remember when I paid mine off felt amazing
Mummy as accountability partner is so sweet! Indian parents love when we call them. Mine says the same thing - why dont you call more. Working on it!
3 gym sessions week 1 is great! The new year crowd will thin out but hopefully you stick with it. Consistency is everything.
Spanish learner here too! The pronunciation struggle is real. My wife laughs at my accent too but hey at least were trying. Buena suerte amigo!
Justin Guitar is great! G to C was hard for me too at first. Now its second nature. Fingers will stop hurting in a couple weeks
Yoga with Adriene is the best for beginners! Shes so encouraging. Im also super inflexible but thats exactly why we need yoga right?
Python buddy! Also doing Codecademy. Hello World gang. We gonna be building apps by end of year watch us.
Both of you check out the r/learnpython subreddit. Super helpful community for beginners. Also freeCodeCamp has good free resources.
Budgeting apps are eye opening right?? I was shocked at my food delivery spending too. Knowledge is power though. Now we can fix it.
Changing phone language is genius! Forced immersion. Might have to try that. Hola from another Spanish learner!
Chess gang! Also started learning this year. My rating is similarly terrible but were improving. Have you tried the Lichess puzzles? Good for tactics.
Yeah doing puzzles daily! My puzzle rating is way higher than my actual game rating lol. Tactics dont transfer to real games yet.
Balcony gardens are great! Basil and mint are perfect starters. Dont overwater and give them lots of sun. Youll be eating fresh herbs in no time.
Being on time is such an underrated skill. People definitely notice and respect it. Buffer time is the key like you said. Good job!
Deleting apps helped me! More friction = less mindless scrolling. If I really want to check I can use browser but usually the urge passes. Try it!
Setting a calendar reminder for lunch helped me! Treat it like a meeting you cant skip. Your future self will thank you.
Half caf is a good transition! Did that when cutting back. Eventually moved to decaf for afternoon cups. Baby steps work better than cold turkey sometimes.
C25K works! Did it a couple years ago. Follow the program even when you feel like you can do more. The rest days are important. Good luck with the charity run!
Meal prep Sundays are the best! What recipes are you making? Always looking for new ideas. The 2 hours investment saves so much time during the week.
I made chicken curry and rice this week. Also good are burrito bowls, stir fry, and pasta bake. Anything that reheats well basically.
Phone in another room gang! The reaching for it and its not there feeling is so real at first. But sleep is so much better now. Worth it.
One week smoke free is huge! The cravings get less intense over time. Week 2 was actually easier for me than week 1
The alcohol free beer trick is so good! Athletic Brewing and Clausthaler are my favorites. Satisfies the habit without the negatives.
Morning surf sounds amazing. I need to get back in the water too. Nothing clears the head like being in the ocean. Keep riding those waves!
Pushups as cigarette replacement is clever! Physical activity helps with cravings. Your arms will be huge by the time youre fully quit haha
4 sessions week 1 with the gym packed is dedication! PPL is a solid program. Youre gonna see gains fast. Keep showing up!
Pomodoro changed my life too! The timer creates urgency that my brain apparently needs. Now I actually get stuff done instead of procrastinating for hours.
50 pushups a day is great! Im doing planks. Bodyweight exercises are underrated. Simple but effective. Keep building that strength!
Writing 500 words a day is how books get written! Most of mine are garbage too lol but occasionally theres something decent
The food delivery spending shock is real! I had same reaction. YNAB is great for awareness. Now comes the hard part - actually sticking to the budget.
Run/walk totally counts! Thats how everyone starts. The important thing is showing up. Youll be running full miles before you know it.
No screens before bed is so hard but so worth it. Sleep quality improvement is noticeable within days. Reading actual books is a nice bonus too.
Idk man sometimes one bad day does matter. I gave up on my resolution last yr after slipping once and never got back on track. not trying to be negative just being real
its always packed in jan then by feb everyones gone lol. see u guys in march... or not
lol wait til week 3 when the novelty wears off. thats when it gets hard. not trying to be a downer but just prepare yourself
pomodoro never worked for me. i just stare at teh timer waiting for it to end lmao. glad its working for u tho
2 lbs in a week is prob just water fluctuation tbh. not trying to discourage u but dont get too excited by early numbers they bounce around alot
cold showers are bro science imo but hey if it works for u then cool. tried it for a month last yr and literally just made me miserable
2 hours a day studying?? how do u even have time for that with work. jealous of ur schedule ngl
fair warning - learning to code takes WAY longer than ppl make it sound. im 6 months in and still feel like i know nothing. dont let tiktok devs fool u into thinking its easy
yall are wild with these cold showers. i tried it once and noped out immediately. props to anyone who can actually do this
walking is fine but if u actually want to lose weight u need to do more than that. 30 min walks wont burn many calories. just being honest
hey dont be too hard on urself. slipping isnt failing, quitting is failing. ur still here posting which means ur still trying. thats what matters
week 1 is hard for everyone. most ppl who look like theyre doing great are probably struggling too and just not posting about it. keep going
cutting sugar is HARD. like one of the hardest things to quit. give yourself some grace. maybe start smaller? instead of no sugar try reducing by half first
ugh i feel this. work life balance is so hard. but also dont give up entirely just because of one bad week. life happens. try again next week
if work is consistently taking over ur weekends that might be a bigger problem than the resolutions tbh. might need to set boundaries with work first before other goals can happen
same
lol mood
this
following for tips
felt this
me every morning lmao
nice
^this
haha yes
yum
lol same boat
wish there was one near me
what app do u use
drop the recipe?
ok wait this is making me want to call my mom rn
weekends are brutal
wait do u do hot then cold or just straight cold
hm
which index funds? asking for a friend lol
god i feel this so hard rn. like WHY is this so difficult. its just not eating sugar. people do it all the time. why cant i. idk. sorry for venting just having a moment
one week is nothing to be disappointed about. i literally quit and restarted the gym like 4 times last year. still here tho. still trying. thats what matters i guess
work will ALWAYS expand to fill the time you give it. learned this the hard way. your job doesnt care about your resolutions. you have to protect your time or nobody will
once is better than zero ok. i need to stop beating myself up about this stuff too. we're all just trying our best out here
meh weeks happen. at least youre being honest about it instead of pretending everything is great. thats more than most people do
NYE screwed up my sleep schedule too and honestly im still recovering. its frustrating bc i was doing so well before. but like... its just one week. not the end of the world. i hope.
showing up when you dont feel like it is literally the whole point. the days you dont want to go are the most important ones. or thats what i tell myself anyway lol
ugh the automatic habit thing is SO real. i catch myself doing stuff without even thinking. like my hand just reaches for it. brains are weird
